titles.title: Mäṣḥafä gәbrä ḥǝmamat “Book of the Rite of the Holy Week”

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Mäṣḥafä gәbrä ḥǝmamat “Book of the Rite of the Holy Week" (fols. 4ra-155rc) I-1) Introduction (fols. 4ra-5vb) I-2) Eve of Palm Sunday (fols. 5vb-7vb) I-3) Palm Sunday (fols. 7vb-13ra) I-4) Monday (fols. 13ra-26vc) I-5) Tuesday (fols. 26vc-40rb) I-6) Wednesday (fols. 40rb-51rc) I-7) Thursday (fols. 51rc-66vb) I-8) Friday (fols. 67ra-121va) I-9) Saturday (fols. 121va-144ra), including: Raʾǝyä Yoḥannǝs "Revelation of John" (fols. 124ra-133vc); Tǝmhǝrtä ḫǝbuʾat “Teaching of Mysteries” (fols. 140vb-142ra) I-10) Homily by Cyriacus of Behnesa [Laḥa Maryam “Lamentation of Mary”] (fols. 145ra-155rc)
Additiones 1-2.

txstates.txstate: All fols. are slightly damaged by rodents at the bottom corners. Fols. 1, 3 and 156 are of irregular, smaller size. Fol. 45 is cut at the top. The leather cover of the front board is slightly damaged (a rectangular piece is torn off).

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with tooled brown leather. Overback made of tooled reddish-brown leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the brown leather cover (at least 8 tools were used: triple line fillet, fourfold line fillet, interlaced line fillet, double circles, 2 types of cross hatching, double sine wave with dots, chain).

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endbands stitches at the spine cover.

squires.squire: A(3; s.l.: 2, no stub/fols. 1r-3v) – I(8/fols. 4r-11v) – II(8/fols. 12r-19v) – III(8/fols. 20r-27v) – IV(8/fols. 28r-35v) – V(8/fols. 36r-43v) – VI(8/fols. 44r-51v) – VII(8/fols. 52r-59v) – VIII(7; s.l.: 3, stub after 5/fols. 60r-66v) – IX(8/fols. 67r-74v) – X(8/fols. 75r-82v) – XI(8/fols. 83r-90v) – XII(8/fols. 91r-98v) – XIII(8/fols. 99r-106v) - XIV(8/fols. 107r-114v) – XV(8/fols. 115r-122v) – XVI(8/fols. 123r-130v) – XVII(8/fols. 131r-138v) – XVIII(6/fols. 139r-144v) – XIX(8/fols. 145r-152v) – B(4/fols. 153r-156v).

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling. Fols. 60rv and 66rv have an additional ruled line in the upper margin.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Fine and careful, by a well-trained hand.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; a few lines (three or five) alternating with black lines on the incipit page of Texts I-1, I-8 and I-10; headings and incipits of the texts, their sections and subsections; titles of the Biblical books and other works; directives for the ministers in Text I-7; names of Hebrew letters in Text I-8; the abbreviation ʾo- in Text I-8; the words: yǝbe mätärgwǝm in Texts I-5, I-6, and I-7, yǝbe in Texts I-5, I-6, I-7 and I-8, (wä-)yǝtärägwǝm in Texts I-6, I-7 and I-8, nastäbäqwǝʿ ḫabekä in Text I-7, ṣällǝyu in Text I-8, ʿƎgziʾo täśähalännä and männu zǝntu in “Tǝmḫǝrtä ḫǝbuʾat” (Text I-9). Elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; Ethiopic numerals or their elements. In Additio 2: Nomina sacra (Maryam and ʾIyäsus and their abbraviations), initial lines of sections, some words (e.g., säbḥat, sälam, täzäkkärku) and their abbreviations, elements of the punctuation signs.

abbreviations.abbreviation: Abbreviations used in Text I: ይሕ፡ for ይብል፡ ሕዝብ፡ (fol. 63rv, Text I-7) ሕ፡ for ሕዝብ፡ (fol. 63r, Text I-7) ይካ፡ for ይብል፡ ካህን፡ (fol. 63rv, Text I-7) ይዲ፡ for ይብል፡ ዲያቆን፡ (fol. 63rv, Text I-7) ኦ፡ for ኦእግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ መድኃኒነ፡ ኄር፡ (fol. 121r, Text I-8) Abbreviations used in Additio 2: ሰላ፡/ሰ፡ for ሰላም፡ ሰብ፡/ሰብሐ፡ for ሰብሐት፡ ማርያ፡/ማር፡ for ማርያም፡ የሱስ፡ for ኢየሱስ፡

otherdetails.otherdetail: - On fol. 144rab, Text I-9 ends with the concluding formula (ተፈጸመ፡ በዝየ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ኅብረተ፡ ቃላት፡…) for the readings of the Holy Week, followed by an exhortation for the scribe, the commissioner and the reader. At the end the name of the individual(s) to whom the supplication is dedicated is not written. - On fol. 155rc, Text I-10 ends with a note on the translation of the homily by ʾabba Sälama (here the name is missing): ለዛቲ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ዘተርጐማ፡ ብፁዕ፡ ርቱዓ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ አቡነ፡ አባ፡ [vac.] ወይጽሐፍ፡ ስሞሙ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ውስተ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ሕይወት፡ በሰማያት፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን። For the same note, cp. also Ms. QSM-002. - Nine dot asterisks and a chain of red and black dots separate the above notes (fols. 144rab,155rab) from the main text and from the following additio. - In some supplication formulas, the names of the individuals to whom the supplication (e.g., the one who purchased the book [zä-ʾaṭräyo], as on fol. 60vc) is dedicated are missing, so the spaces for them are unfilled: e.g., fols. 60vc, 62va, 63vb, 66vb. - The last line on fol. 61r (columns a b) was left empty.

additional.cont: Fol. 1r-v:  Inventory of the books of  Gänaḥti Qǝddǝst Maryam.
Fols. 2ra-vc, 144rb-vc, 155rc-156rb: Unidentified hymns to Mary.
additional.det: The note is written in a careful hand, more recent then the main text. The text is distributed on several fols.: in quire A, after Text I-9 and at the end of the Ms. (fols. 155rc-156rb). The reading is indicated (zä-nägh) in the upper margin of fol. 2r.

extras.extra: - Excerpts of hymns for the Good Friday (?) added (in black and red ink; some encircled by lines) in the upper margins: fols. 84r, 84v, 90r, 90v, 103v, 104r, 110r, 110v, 123v. - Pen trial: fol. 3v. - Crude drawing in pencil on the bottom turn-ins of the front cover. - Crude minor notes in blue pen in the upper margin: fols. 62r, 69r, 105r, 139r.
